ext_descriptions.ext_description: Applied_risk_consequence relates a risk_consequence to a risk_impact.
A name for the applied_risk_consequence.
A description of the applied_risk_consequence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies an impact for the pertaining consequence.
This attribute identifies the pertaining consequence that has an impact.
This attribute indicates a role for the applied_risk_consequence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Applied_risk_criteria assigns related criteria as one or any combination from risk_perception, applied_risk_source_assignment, or risk_treatment as inputs to risk_criteria.
This attribute identifies the pertaining risk_criteria.
This attribute identifies any related criteria.
This attribute indicates a role for the applied_risk_criteria.
Applied_risk_impact_assignment assigns impact_items to a risk_impact.
This attribute identifies the risk_impact.
This attribute identifies the risk_impact_items.
This attribute indicates a role for the applied_risk_impact_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Applied_risk_probability assigns risk_items with a risk_probability.
A name for the applied_risk_probability.
A description of the applied_risk_probability. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the risk_probability.
This attribute identifies the risk_items, such as an event, which has a probability of occurring.
This attribute indicates a role for the applied_risk_probability.

Applied_risk_source_assignment assigns a risk_source_item to a risk. The source of risk is typically an activity such as nuclear power generation, naval flight night-time operation, crude oil refining, or automobile manufacturing.
This attribute identifies the source of risk.
This attribute identifies the risk.
This attribute indicates a role for the applied_risk_source_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Defined_risk_consequence relates a risk_consequence with a risk.
A name for the defined_risk_consequence.
A description of the defined_risk_consequence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the relating risk_consequence.
This attribute identifies the related risk.
Defined_risk_probability relates a risk_probability with a risk.
A name for the defined_risk_probability.
A description of the defined_risk_probability. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the relating risk_probability.
This attribute identifies the related risk.
Residual_risk identifies the remaining risk after risk_reduction.
A name for the residual_risk.
A description of the residual_risk. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the risk_reduction.
This attribute identifies the remaining risk.
Risk is the combination of the probability of an event and its consequence. In some situations, risk is a deviation from the expected.
The identifier that distinguishes the risk.
A name for the risk.
A description of the risk. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute addresses whether the risk has been negated.

Risk_consequence is the outcome of an event. There may be one or more consequences of an event. Consequences can range from positive to negative. However, consequences are always negative for safety aspects. Consequences can be expressed qualitatively or quantitatively.
A name for the risk_consequence .
A description of the risk_consequence . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Risk_context is a set of circumstances surrounding a particular risk.
A name for the risk_context .
A description of the risk_context . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies possible risk_criteria that can be used to define risk_context
This attribute identifies the related risk.

Risk_criteria identifies the terms of reference by which the significance of risk is assessed. Risk criteria include associated cost and benefits, legal and statutory requirements, socio-economic and environmental aspects, the concerns of stakeholders, priorities and other inputs to the assessment.
A name for the risk_criteria .
A description of the risk_criteria . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Risk_impact is the effect of a risk_consequence.
A name for the risk_impact.
A description of the risk_impact. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute describes the severity of risk_impact. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

Risk_perception is a set of values or concerns with which a stakeholder views a particular risk. Risk perception depends on the stakeholder's expressed needs, issues, and knowledge. Risk perception can differ from objective data.
A name for the risk_perception.
A description of the risk_perception. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute relates a perceived_probability of occurrence with the perceived risk_consequence and corresponding risk_impact.
This attribute relates a perceived_consequence with the the perceived risk_probability of the risk_item.
This attribute identifies the perceivable risk.
Risk_perception_relationship relates two risk_perception entities.
A name for the risk_perception_relationship.
A description of the risk_perception_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the relating risk_perception.
This attribute identifies the related risk_perception.
Risk_probability is a probability pertaining to risk.
A name for the risk_probability.
A description of the risk_probability. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Risk_reduction is an action taken to lessen the probability, negative consequences, or both, associated with a particular risk.
The identifier that distinguishes the risk_reduction.
A name for the risk_reduction.
A description of the risk_reduction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies any assumption used in risk_reduction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the risk_treatment used in risk_reduction.
Risk_reduction aims to resolve by minimizing or eliminating the risk itself or any combination of its components. The risk or any its components are identified with mitigation_select.
Risk_relationship relates two risks to one another.
The identifier that distinguishes the risk_relationship.
A name for the risk_relationship.
A description of the risk_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the relating risk.
This attribute identifies the related risk.
This attribute indicates a role for the risk_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Risk_source_role specifies the purpose of the association of a risk to a risk_source_item.
A name for the risk_source_role.
A description of the risk_source_role. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Risk_status provides a status to the risk.
The identifier that distinguishes the risk_status. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A name for the risk_status.
A description of the risk_status. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies the risk having risk_status.

Risk_treatment is the process of selection and implementation of measures to modify risk. The term risk treatment is sometimes used for the measures themselves. Risk treatment measures can include avoiding, optimizing, transferring or retaining risk.
The identifier that distinguishes the risk_treatment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A name for the risk_treatment.
A description of the risk_treatment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute identifies a rationale used in selecting risk_treatment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
